events.name: Digital Transformation – The Journey to A Paperless Office
events.description: Many organisations are going through a digital transformation and facing a common set of challenges. Considering the overall solution, rather than just one element, such as making a paper form an online form, is essential for digital transformation to create a positive impact in your company. This event will explore new technologies for digital enablement and provide deep insights on strategy for digital transformation. Sessions will focus on workflow, electronic forms, and digital signatures using real-world case studies. AGENDA 8:30am - 9:00am Registration 9:00am - 10am Session: Digital Transformation Through the Cloud Speaker: Gayan Peiris, Business Productivity Solution Specialist, Microsoft 10am - 10:15am Morning Break - Coffee/Tea and Snacks 10:15am – 11:15am Session: Transforming Business Across the Globe Speaker: Andy Gunawan, Territory Manager - Asia, Nintex  11:15am- 12:15pm Partner Case Study: Transforming Document Management with Nintex - McDermott  Speaker: Milan Gross, Principal, Synergy 12:15pm - 1:15pm Lunch Break - Lunch will be provided 1:15pm - 2:15pm Session: Transforming Digital Signatures with Docusign Speaker: Wilson Oh, Head of Business Development & Alliance - ASIA, DocuSign 2:15pm – 3:15pm Session: Business Process Automation with Nintex Speaker: Kokkoon Gan, Technical Evangelist, Nintex 3:15pm - 3:30pm Afternoon Tea Break - Coffee/Tea and Snacks 3:30pm-4:30pm Partner Case Study: Transforming the Back Office with Nintex - Boston Scientific Speaker: Milan Gross, Principal, Synergy 4:30pm - 5:00pm Closing
events.location: Microsoft Operations Pte Ltd, 22CF12, Level 22, One Marina Boulevard, Singapore

events.name: Bi-Monthly BTC in SG Meetup
events.description: Let's all get together where delicious food & drinks are sold for BTC, hobnob about the bitcoin lifestyle & entrepreneurship scene in town, and kick this meetup off. If you're interesting in giving a talk to the BTC community in SG, sharing your idea & startup, getting beta users, etc., let me know. We're looking to have a few meetups with awesome speakers & thought leaders starting the night's conversation. -------- Side note: Sarnie's cafe accepts Bitcoin, and they're really being cool by giving us so much of their space at peak hours to have our meetup there. So, it's cool and supportive if you order from their menu (for bitcoin, of course). They also happen to make shockingly delicious food (I highly recommend the Chicken In A Paper Bag), and damn good coffee (their own custom house blend).

events.name: Hackware v1.6
events.description:
Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers.  Come and just drop by for all our open and free meetups, make friends with fellow enthusiasts or beginners and feel free to sign up for a talk slot on whatever you are working on. Talks for this meetup: Get to know more about the Prototyping lab, one of the most well-equipped makerspaces in Singapore from Seth Loh Wei Chen from OneMaker Group - OMG. 



1. (15min) Raspberry Pi 3 + UART/Bluetooth issues - Yeo Kheng Meng 2. (10min) Design approaches in making mechanical toys - Michael Sng Woei Shyong 3. (20min) ESPresso Lite v2.0 from ESPert- William Hooi 4. (20min) Working with Classic Bluetooth for Arduino Projects - Martin Leong  5. (5min) Engineers.SG equipment - Michael Cheng 6. Announcements by anyone on: - Hiring positions- Available for hire- Other upcoming hardware-related events locally or anywhere else 7. Show and Tell Talks : ~20minsTalks typically include side projects of speakers on electronics, embedded system, radio communications, internet of things and much more. We want to hear about an electronics project that you already implemented at home or anywhere. Lightning Talks : ~5minsLightning talks are short electronics demo that are working or even incomplete based on open source hardware and software. We wanna see all your fried chips and electronics to be fixed. Nothing has to be perfect - we are all learning. Bring them! (No product videos or proprietery technology.) Announcements: ~1minAnnouncement can be done by anyone looking to get hired or hire someone. Talk about your project / company and tell us who you are looking for. Show and Tell: ~free and easy Bring your completed / uncompleted hardware projects and ask for feedback and share your learnings. ♥ Venue sponsored by OneMaker Group - OMG Prototyping Lab. Some light refreshments will be provided by OMG ♥
events.location: Prototyping Lab, 111 Middle Road, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969
